node.title: NZ Automotive Investments earnings hit by rise of NZ dollar against Japanese yen
node.description: A sharp rise in the value of the New Zealand dollar against the Japanese yen has eaten into the earnings for second-hand car dealer NZ Automotive Investments.

node.title: Policing of anti-mandate protest cost more than $430k, excluding wages
node.description: The police operation set up to respond to the illegal occupation at Parliament has cost taxpayers more than $430,000.

node.title: Police searching for David Tuitupou after Auckland shooting
node.description: Police investigating a shooting incident in Auckland last month are appealing for the public's assistance in locating David Tuitupou.

node.title: Doctors suspended over anti-vax claims win court appeals
node.description: Today's judgement says the Medical Council wrongly suspended the two doctors before investigations were completed.

node.title: Two South Korean air force planes collide, killing 3, injuring 1
node.description: The KT-1 trainer aircraft crashed into a mountain in the southeastern city of Sacheon. The crash's cause wasn't immediately known.

node.title: Three times more ASB customers fell for investment scams over past two years
node.description: Data released by ASB this April Fool's Day indicates investment scams, particularly those involving crypto-currency, top list of scams over the past two years.

node.title: Samoa records first Covid-19 related death
node.description: The death in Samoa comes 13 days after the first community transmission case was detected.

node.title: More efficient utes imported due to Clean Car Discount scheme - Transport Minister
node.description: Transport Minister Michael Wood says the introduction of the Clean Car Discount scheme has already seen importers bringing in more efficient utes which attract a lower emissions charge. Audio

node.title: Covid-19 update: 17 deaths, 13,475 cases, 764 in hospital
node.description: The number of people in hospital with Covid-19 continues to fall, but there have still been 13,475 new cases in the community and 17 more deaths reported in New Zealand today.

node.title: Censoring content: Readers reminded not to judge a book by its cover
node.description: Marlborough's libraries will not censor content just because someone takes offence to it.

node.title: Council planning committee considers call to clamp down on helipads on Waiheke
node.description: Auckland councillors are being asked to step in over the safety of helicopter flights over Waiheke Island.

node.title: Turnover of psychologists reaches 60% in some regions - union
node.description: There are 148 vacant psychologist positions across the country in DHBs and the Education Ministry, new data shows.

node.title: National launches troll hunt: Online abuse 'unacceptable'
node.description: Accusations a Young Nat has been trolling female politicians online has prompted an investigation by the National Party, with the abuse denounced as cowardice on all sides.

node.title: Lawmakers close to deal on smaller $10 billion COVID bill
node.description: The legislation would finance vaccines, treatments and tests, as Biden and Democrats have warned that the government is running out of money to pay for the fight against COVID.

node.title: EPA upholds Trump-era decision not to regulate drinking water contaminant
node.description: The chemical perchlorate is used in rocket fuel and fireworks.

node.title: Burglars seeking fuel threatened property owner with firearm - police
node.description: A group of people used a firearm to threaten a property owner while they were trying to steal fuel, police say.

node.title: Ukraine war: Putin being misled by fearful advisers, US says
node.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is being misled by advisers who are too scared to tell him how badly the war in Ukraine is going, the White House says.

node.title: Nelson scraps long-awaited pride crossing
node.description: The council's initial proposal has been revoked after it was found it did not take into account the needs of blind and low vision citizens.

node.title: AUT's new Vice-Chancellor: 'The digital divide is a real thing'
node.description: Professor Damon Salesa says the pandemic illuminated inequities in the education sector, with online learning hindering many students' ability to participate.

node.title: Battle for Raqqa offers "cautionary tale" on harm to civilians in urban combat, report says
node.description: The report by the think tank RAND concluded that while the Defense Department made efforts to prevent civilian harm in the 2017 battle for Raqqa, there remains room for improvement.

node.title: Sports fandom, parochialism and Barcelona - Bidwell
node.description: Opinion - there comes a time for sports fans to grow up and step back down to earth, such as those cut up over the venue for next America's Cup, writes Hamish Bidwell.

node.title: East Coast braces for another night of dangerous storms
node.description: A dozen states in the South reported at least 25 tornadoes this week, as severe storms move up the East Coast.

node.title: 1 police officer dead, 2 wounded in Pennsylvania shooting
node.description: The suspect has also died.

node.title: Coastal plan risks ‘alienating’ Westport
node.description: Consultation will be delayed for Westport on the coastal hazard section of the new Te Tai o Poutini Plan, after a plea from Buller District Council that seeking more feedback at this time risks…

node.title: Tairāwhiti civil defence state of emergency lifted
node.description: MetService said Gisborne had one of its five wettest Marches in almost 90 years, and Te Puia Springs had its wettest month of any month in five years.

node.title: LAPD offered to arrest Will Smith, but Chris Rock declined, Oscars producer says
node.description: After authorities listed all of his options, Rock was "dismissive" and decided not to press charges, Will Packer, a producer for the awards show, told ABC's "Good Morning America."

node.title: Calls for review into $290m tourism fund to fix 'uneven playing fields'
node.description: The co-owner of a major tourist business says the government has no understanding of tourism and appears to have given money to its mates without due process. Audio

node.title: Fentanyl pill seizures increased nearly 50-fold since 2018, study says
node.description: The rise in seizures comes following a record high number of overdose deaths in the country, researchers said.

node.title: Expanded flu vaccination campaign begins ahead of winter spread
node.description: With Covid-19 continuing to spread in New Zealand, lower levels of immunity against the flu and other winter illnesses could mean further heightened pressure on the health system.

node.title: Businesses furious govt 'picked favourites' for $290m tourism fund
node.description: The top watchdog has criticised a government tourism fund, that handed out hundreds of millions dollars, for a lack of transparency and clarity - and many in the industry are fuming.
